text: alright step one with our tune-up okay
let's prep our mango which is very
simple just take about four or five nice
thin slices off a mango once you peel it
I only peeled half so I can hold on to
the other half and I'll eat that other
half for breakfast tomorrow but so I got
four or five slices of mango I'm going
to cut it one way into little sticks and
then you're gonna turn it and just go
across the other way into a nice
consistent dice alright so what makes
this dish look really nice is really the
cuts on the on the tuna and the fruits
here so take your time and really what
you're going for is consistency okay so
don't be in a hurry I'm using one nice
forward slicing motion which i think is
a very easy way to control a cut versus
the chopping down you see a lot on TV so
take your time with that same with the
avocado all right we're gonna take a
half an avocado we're going to slice it
one way we're gonna cut it into strips
the other way and then we're just gonna
turn it and give it a little dice and
again try to pick out a an avocado
that's not too not too soft okay this
one was just amazingly perfectly right
but even a little firmer than this would
have been good all right we're gonna
mince some ginger
now again ginger very traditional with
Tunip okay you can find fresh ginger in
any grocery store now we're just going
to take those called hands of ginger
just break off one of the little half of
fingers and give it a really fine mince
now again the it's easier to mince if
you start like I did and go really
really thin strips here and then cut it
to almost like threads of ginger and I'm
gonna go ahead and mince it just very
quick all right
the tuna that you're gonna see me
working with in a minute here has been
put in the freezer for about an hour
before I try to cut up my tuna very
difficult to cut tuna that's room
temperature just from the fridge so
that's in the freezer for an hour hard
to see on a camera here but it's nice
and firm and easy to cut I'm gonna take
off the skin you're gonna take off any
that really dark that's called bloodline
that dark meat that's not good and then
this bottom triangle here has a lot of
membranes in it
I'm gonna cut that off and save that for
a tuna salad I just want this perfect
center cut piece which is gonna be about
a pound
so from that Center cut piece you're
gonna cut slices you're gonna cut strips
and you're gonna dice it just like the
mango all right so take your time again
if it's a half-frozen this is really
easy all right put it in a bowl and
we're gonna add our flavorings here so
you throw you saw me throwing the minced
ginger I'm gonna squeeze half us that
was a pretty small lime so half a lime
all right now again the acid in this the
rice vinegar in the lime is what's
really gonna bring it all together I'll
explain that a little more later I'm
also gonna add about a teaspoon of this
garlic chili paste find that in the
Asian section of your grocery store all
right any hot pepper will do
there's my mango I'm gonna take a fork
and just give it a little mix here get
all that ginger mixed around break up
any mango pieces all right and then the
other acid that's going in here is 2
tablespoons of seasoned rice vinegar so
make sure using this seasoned it already
has a little salt sugar in it they also
sell unseasoned rice vinegar at the
store which I use for other things but
this is actually the season variety all
right the other thing in here is we need
some soy sauce ok so what's gonna really
bring up this tuna flavor and that
beautiful sweetness of the fruit is a
little salty kick here so about a
tablespoon of soy sauce and give that
another mix and then the last ingredient
here which is the most fragile would be
your avocado dice so you see me with the
tip of the spoon they're just breaking
up those pieces and that's going to go
back in the fridge until we're ready to
mold now how I made this shape here
which is really makes for a nice
presentation just put some saran wrap in
some ramekins or anything any shape you
want and I'm going to put it in three or
four night spoons of the mixture and I'm
gonna give it a little press with the
back of the spoon now again I'm not
crushing it but I do want it to be a
nice firm texture when I unmold this now
you're going to wrap those up and you're
gonna put them in the fridge for one
hour one hour will still give you a raw
tuna and I'll explain later if you want
it to be a little more cooked
quote-unquote now for the top I'm going
to put a little bit of sauce here fresh
cilantro some more that rice vinegar and
to taste another tablespoon or so
chili paste really nice sweet spicy love
cilantro all right you're gonna unmold
it and again you're gonna be amazed at
that beautiful shiny translucent texture
of the tuna and those colorful fruits
coming through and a little dots of red
from the chili and it so fresh so
delicious such a great great appetizer
now that was one hour this is still raw
tuna alright just drizzle a little sauce
on if you want it to be more cooked let
it sit for two or three hours and the
acid will actually cook the tuna and
you'll have like a tuna ceviche so you
know if you want try it that way I
suggest you do it this way alright well
I think you'll enjoy this and last thing
here those fried wonton chips I'm
